User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the system with role-based access control (Admin).

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

email.description: The email address of the user, used for login and communication.

role.description: The role of the user, which is always 'Admin' in this system.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the user account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the user account was last updated.

MedicineComposition.title: MedicineComposition
MedicineComposition.description: Represents the generic chemical composition of medicines, allowing for generic search and alternative suggestions.

id.description: Unique identifier for the MedicineComposition entity (e.g., a composition ID).

name.description: The common name of the chemical composition (e.g., 'Paracetamol', 'Ibuprofen').

description.description: A detailed description or common uses of the composition.

aiMatchApproved.description: Indicates if an AI-suggested composition match has been reviewed and approved by an Admin.

aiMatchSuggestion.description: The AI tool's suggested composition name, if different from the entered one, awaiting Admin review.

Medicine.title: Medicine
Medicine.description: Details of a specific medicine product, including pricing, units of measure, and reorder points. This acts as the inventory item.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Medicine entity.

name.description: Commercial brand name of the medicine (e.g., 'Crocin Advance', 'Saridon').

company.description: The pharmaceutical company or manufacturer of the medicine.

storeBox.description: Physical location or storage box identifier within the store (e.g., 'Shelf A-1', 'Drawer 3').

basePurchasePrice.description: The standard purchase price per smallest unit of the medicine.

baseSellingPrice.description: The standard selling price per smallest unit of the medicine.

tabletsPerStrip.description: The number of tablets contained within one strip.

stripsPerBox.description: The number of strips contained within one box.

reorderPoint.description: The minimum stock threshold (in smallest units) at which a reorder alert is triggered.

taxRateGst.description: The GST (Goods and Services Tax) rate applicable to this medicine, as a percentage.

imageUrl.description: Optional URL to an image of the medicine product.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the medicine record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the medicine record was last updated.

Batch.title: Batch
Batch.description: Manages individual batches of medicines, tracking expiry dates, quantities, and purchase details for FEFO management.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Batch entity.

medicineName.description: Denormalized name of the medicine for efficient lookups.

batchNumber.description: The manufacturer-assigned batch number for this specific production lot of medicine.

expiryDate.description: The expiry date of the medicine batch, crucial for FEFO and expiry alerts.

quantityInSmallestUnits.description: The current quantity of medicine in this batch, expressed in the smallest measurable units.

purchasePricePerSmallestUnit.description: The cost price for each smallest unit of medicine in this specific batch when purchased.

supplierId.description: Reference to Supplier, who supplied this batch. (Relationship: Supplier 1:N Batch)

receivedAt.description: Timestamp when this medicine batch was received into inventory.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the batch record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the batch record was last updated.

Supplier.title: Supplier
Supplier.description: Manages information about medicine suppliers/vendors for procurement and returns.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Supplier entity.

name.description: The name of the supplier or vendor company.

contactPerson.description: The name of the primary contact person at the supplier.

phoneNumber.description: The contact phone number for the supplier.

email.description: The email address for the supplier.

address.description: The physical address of the supplier.

accountPayableBalance.description: The current outstanding amount owed to this supplier.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the supplier record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the supplier record was last updated.

PurchaseOrder.title: PurchaseOrder
PurchaseOrder.description: Represents an order placed with a supplier for replenishing medicine stock, often triggered by ROP alerts.

id.description: Unique identifier for the PurchaseOrder entity.

orderDate.description: The date and time the purchase order was created or placed.

status.description: The current status of the purchase order (e.g., 'Pending', 'Ordered', 'Received', 'Cancelled').

totalAmount.description: The calculated total monetary amount of the purchase order.

createdByUserId.description: Reference to User who created this purchase order. (Relationship: User 1:N PurchaseOrder)

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the purchase order record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the purchase order record was last updated.

PurchaseOrderItem.title: PurchaseOrderItem
PurchaseOrderItem.description: Details of a single medicine item included in a purchase order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the PurchaseOrderItem entity.

requestedQuantity.description: The quantity of medicine requested in this item, in its smallest units.

unitPriceAtOrder.description: The agreed unit price (per smallest unit) for this medicine at the time of placing the order.

totalPrice.description: The total price for this specific line item (quantity * unitPriceAtOrder).

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the purchase order item record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the purchase order item record was last updated.

Customer.title: Customer
Customer.description: Represents a customer account managed by the admin, including their details and financial standing.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Customer entity, typically an admin-created ID.

name.description: The full name of the customer.

phoneNumber.description: The contact phone number of the customer.

email.description: The email address of the customer.

address.description: The physical address of the customer.

debtAmount.description: The current outstanding debt amount owed by the customer.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the customer record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the customer record was last updated.

CustomerAccountTransaction.title: CustomerAccountTransaction
CustomerAccountTransaction.description: Records financial transactions related to a customer's account, such as payments or debt adjustments.

id.description: Unique identifier for the CustomerAccountTransaction entity.

transactionDate.description: The date and time when the transaction occurred.

amount.description: The monetary amount of the transaction.

paymentMethod.description: The method of payment if applicable (e.g., 'Cash', 'UPI', 'Credit Card', 'Debt').

description.description: A brief description or note about the transaction.

relatedSaleId.description: Optional reference to a Sale, if this transaction is directly related to a specific sale. (Relationship: Sale 1:N CustomerAccountTransaction)

createdByUserId.description: Reference to User who recorded this customer account transaction. (Relationship: User 1:N CustomerAccountTransaction)

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the customer account transaction record was created.

Sale.title: Sale
Sale.description: Records details of a customer purchase or bill, ensuring transactional integrity with stock levels.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Sale entity.

saleDate.description: The date and time when the sale occurred.

customerId.description: Optional reference to Customer if the sale is linked to a customer account. (Relationship: Customer 1:N Sale)

totalAmountBeforeTax.description: The total monetary amount of the sale before any taxes are applied.

totalTaxAmount.description: The total tax amount (e.g., GST) applied to the entire sale.

totalAmountDue.description: The final total monetary amount due for the sale, including all taxes.

amountPaid.description: The amount paid by the customer for this sale.

balanceDue.description: The remaining balance due for the sale (totalAmountDue - amountPaid).

paymentMethod.description: The payment method used for the sale (e.g., 'Cash', 'UPI', 'Card', 'Debt').

invoiceNumber.description: A unique invoice number generated for this sale.

createdByUserId.description: Reference to User (Admin) who processed this sale. (Relationship: User 1:N Sale)

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the sale record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the sale record was last updated.

SaleItem.title: SaleItem
SaleItem.description: Details of a single medicine item included in a sale transaction, linking to the specific batch sold.

id.description: Unique identifier for the SaleItem entity.

batchId.description: Reference to Batch, indicating which specific batch of the medicine was sold. (Relationship: Batch 1:N SaleItem)

quantitySold.description: The quantity of medicine sold in this item, in its smallest units.

unitSellingPrice.description: The selling price per smallest unit of medicine at the time of sale.

purchasePriceAtSale.description: The purchase price per smallest unit from the batch at the time of sale, used for profit calculation.

gstRateApplied.description: The GST rate applied to this item at the time of sale, as a percentage.

itemTotalBeforeTax.description: The total price for this item before tax (quantitySold * unitSellingPrice).

itemTaxAmount.description: The total tax amount for this specific item.

itemTotalWithTax.description: The final total price for this item including tax.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the sale item record was created.

ReturnToVendor.title: ReturnToVendor
ReturnToVendor.description: Records details of medicine batches returned to a supplier due to expiry, damage, or other reasons.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ReturnToVendor entity.

supplierId.description: Reference to Supplier to whom the items are being returned. (Relationship: Supplier 1:N ReturnToVendor)

returnDate.description: The date and time when the return to vendor was initiated or processed.

reason.description: The reason for returning the items (e.g., 'Expired', 'Damaged', 'Overstock').

totalCreditExpected.description: The total monetary value of the items being returned, expected as a credit from the supplier.

status.description: The current status of the return process (e.g., 'Pending', 'Completed', 'Cancelled').

createdByUserId.description: Reference to User who initiated the return to vendor. (Relationship: User 1:N ReturnToVendor)

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the return to vendor record was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the return to vendor record was last updated.

ReturnToVendorItem.title: ReturnToVendorItem
ReturnToVendorItem.description: Details of a single medicine item included in a return to vendor transaction.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ReturnToVendorItem entity.

batchId.description: Reference to Batch, indicating which specific batch of the medicine was returned. (Relationship: Batch 1:N ReturnToVendorItem)

quantityReturned.description: The quantity of medicine items returned, in its smallest units.

unitCreditValue.description: The monetary value per smallest unit expected as credit from the supplier for this returned item.

itemTotalCreditValue.description: The total monetary value for this specific line item being returned (quantityReturned * unitCreditValue).

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the return to vendor item record was created.

StockAdjustmentLog.title: StockAdjustmentLog
StockAdjustmentLog.description: An immutable log of all manual adjustments made to medicine stock for auditing and compliance.

id.description: Unique identifier for the StockAdjustmentLog entity.

medicineId.description: Reference to Medicine whose stock was adjusted. (Relationship: Medicine 1:N StockAdjustmentLog)

batchId.description: Optional reference to Batch, if a specific batch's stock was adjusted. (Relationship: Batch 1:N StockAdjustmentLog)

adjustmentDate.description: The date and time when the stock adjustment occurred.

adjustmentType.description: The type of adjustment (e.g., 'Manual Increase', 'Manual Decrease', 'Stocktake', 'ReturnToVendor', 'Sale').

oldQuantity.description: The quantity of the medicine (in smallest units) before the adjustment.

newQuantity.description: The quantity of the medicine (in smallest units) after the adjustment.

adjustedByUserId.description: Reference to User who performed the stock adjustment. (Relationship: User 1:N StockAdjustmentLog)

reason.description: A detailed reason for the stock adjustment (e.g., 'Damaged Packaging', 'Inventory Count Discrepancy').

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the audit log record was created.

PublicMedicineRequest.title: PublicMedicineRequest
PublicMedicineRequest.description: Represents a medicine request submitted by a public, non-authenticated user from the website.

id.description: Unique identifier for the PublicMedicineRequest entity.

name.description: The name of the person requesting the medicine.

contactNumber.description: Contact phone number for the requester.

place.description: The city, town, or village of the requester.

medicineName.description: The name of the requested medicine and any other details.

status.description: The current status of the request.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the request was created.

firestore.reasoning:
The proposed Firestore structure for 'Sateri Medical' prioritizes security, scalability, and debuggability by adhering to the core design principles, especially Authorization Independence and Structural Segregation. The design leverages top-level collections for universally accessible or globally managed entities and subcollections for tightly coupled transactional or itemized data. Authorization relies on a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) model, where a user's role ('Admin') is stored in their respective `/users/{userId}` document. Security rules will fetch this role to determine read/write permissions across collections.

Authorization Independence is achieved primarily through denormalization. For subcollections that conceptually depend on a parent document's authorization context (e.g., `PurchaseOrderItem` needing the `PurchaseOrder`'s creator's permissions), the necessary authorization fields (like `createdByUserId` from the parent) are explicitly copied into each subcollection document (e.g., `purchaseOrderCreatedByUserId` in `PurchaseOrderItem`). This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in Firestore Security Rules to retrieve parent documents for authorization checks. This approach ensures that atomic operations (transactions/batches) involving parent and child documents remain secure and do not encounter `get()`-related rule evaluation issues.

Queryability and Authorization (QAPs - Rules are not Filters) are supported by segregating data based on its security posture:

1.  **Globally Accessible (with Role-Based Write):** Collections like `/medicine_compositions`, `/medicines`, `/batches`, and `/suppliers` are designed to be globally readable by all authenticated 'Admin' users. Write access to these collections is restricted to 'Admin' users only. This homogeneous security posture allows for efficient `list` queries (e.g., listing all medicines) without requiring complex `where` clauses for authorization, as the rules already ensure only authorized users can perform these operations.

2.  **User-Owned/Context-Specific Data:** Collections such as `/sales`, `/purchase_orders`, `/returns_to_vendor`, and `/stock_adjustment_logs` contain a `createdByUserId` or similar field explicitly linking them to the creating user (Admin). For example, an 'Admin' can `list` their own sales from `/sales` because the rules will enforce `request.auth.uid == resource.data.createdByUserId` for write operations and allow reads for specific users or admins globally. This design ensures that a user can only access documents they are authorized for directly through a field in the document, without filtering the query results in the rules.

3.  **Customer Management:** `/customers` is a top-level collection managed by 'Admin', with reads for all authenticated users. `CustomerAccountTransaction`s are subcollections under a specific customer, containing `createdByUserId` to track which Admin processed the transaction.
